result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joel F. Verzal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Follow conditions as outlined in Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement, if complies count will be dismissed

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Counseling as required

Count 1 - Deferred for 2 years

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Commence no later than 3-27-16 at 6:00 pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel F. Verzal

records.addlTxt: 01:13 PM Defendant Joel F. Verzal not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Ct. 1.  Court orders Ct. 1 dismissed.

Court calls  @ 1:36 pm.  Defendant Joel F. Verzal not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to extend for 1 year, and gives reason. State has complied with victim rights. Court will grant extension for 1 year.  Review hearing scheduled for January 30, 2019 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing, and order extending probation for unpaid court obligations w/attachments

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Bennett withdrawing as counsel

Defendant Joel F. Verzal in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Called at 10:08 am.   Plea agreement.  State has complied with Victims rights.  Plea to ct 1 Jmt to be deferred.  CT 2 sentence withheld probation  Ct 3 sentence withheld probation with jail.  Restitution  on ct 2 $1272.29 and $200.00  Atty Bennett agrees with plea agreement.  Plea advisement form filed and reviewed.  Ct 1 - Burglary - No contest plea.  Ct 2 -  Criminal damage -No contest   Ct 3 -  Obstructing -No contest plea.  Constitutional rights reviewed, elements of charges and right to jury trial reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas.  Court will accept pleas to all charges.  Guilty of ct 2 & 3.  Ct 1 Judgment deferred.  Court signs agreement.  If complies count will be dismissed.  R.K. victim gives statement.  Statement by DA for sentencing.   Atty Bennett presents sentencing  arguments.  Statement by def.  Court orders Ct 2 sentence withheld, probation 2 yrs.  Counseling as required.  Restitution  $1272.29 and $200.00.  Cost plus DNA surcharge and sample  Ct 3 sentence withheld 2 yrs probation   Concurrent with ct 2.  Counseling as required and cost plus DNA surcharge.  Jail 60 days   Huber privileges.  Commence no later than 3-27-16 at 6:00 pm    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Bond to be returned to poster.  Post conviction rights  Review hearing scheduled for January 30, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joel F. Verzal in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:35 p.m. Waiver of prelim filed. Court reviews with Def. Accepts waiver as freely & knowingly made. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all juris. objections. Enter not guilty pleas to all cts. Court receives not guilty pleas and enters into record. Def does not have to appear at status conf. however, Court encourages to attend and to remain in contact with Atty Bennett.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joel F. Verzal in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Special appearance and reserve jurisdicational objections.  Preliminary hearing request.  Bond will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joel F. Verzal in court via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:14 p.m. Def has copy of complaint. Charges, possible penalties, atty rights reviewed. State heard on bond, asks for $500 cash with condition.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm. (Clarified with Judge, warrant vacated.)
No contact with R. K.  or his property at N3220 Western Avenue or his home.
